ai-mn142:2.1_0: Then Mahāpajāpatī Gotamī approached the Buddha bringing a new pair of garments.

ai-mn142:2.2_0: “Sir, I have spun and woven this new pair of garments specially for the Buddha.
ai-mn142:2.3_0: May the Buddha please accept this from me out of compassion.”

ai-mn142:3.1_0: After this was said, venerable Ānanda addressed the Fortunate One, (saying):
ai-mn142:3.3_0: Sir, Mahāpajāpatī was very helpful to the Buddha. As his aunt, she raised him, nurtured him, and gave him her milk.
ai-mn142:3.4_0: When the Buddha’s birth mother passed away, she nurtured him at her own breast.
ai-mn142:3.5_0: And the Buddha has been very helpful to Mahāpajāpatī.
ai-mn142:3.6_0: It is owing to the Buddha that Mahāpajāpatī has gone for refuge to the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha.
ai-mn142:3.7_0: It’s owing to the Buddha that she doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or use alcoholic drinks that cause negligence.
ai-mn142:3.8_0: It is owing to experiential confidence in the Buddha, the teaching, and the Saṅgha, and has the ethics loved by the noble ones.
ai-mn142:3.9_0: It’s owing to the Buddha that she is free of doubt regarding suffering, its origin, its cessation, and the practice that leads to its cessation.
ai-mn142:3.10_0: The Buddha has been very helpful to Mahāpajāpatī.”

ai-mn142:5.1_0: Ānanda, there are these fourteen religious donations to individuals.
ai-mn142:5.3_0: One gives a gift to the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
ai-mn142:5.4_0: this is the first offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.5_0: One gives a gift to a Buddha awakened for themselves.
ai-mn142:5.6_0: this is the second offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.7_0: One gives a gift to a perfected one.
ai-mn142:5.8_0: this is the third offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.9_0: One gives a gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of perfection.
ai-mn142:5.10_0: this is the fourth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.11_0: One gives a gift to a non-returner.
ai-mn142:5.12_0: this is the fifth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.13_0: One gives a gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of non-return.
ai-mn142:5.14_0: this is the sixth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.15_0: One gives a gift to a once-returner.
ai-mn142:5.16_0: this is the seventh offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.17_0: One gives a gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of once-return.
ai-mn142:5.18_0: this is the eighth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.19_0: One gives a gift to a stream-enterer.
ai-mn142:5.20_0: this is the ninth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.21_0: One gives a gift to someone practicing to realize the fruit of stream-entry.
ai-mn142:5.22_0: this is the tenth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.23_0: One gives a gift to an outsider who is free of sensual desire.
ai-mn142:5.24_0: this is the eleventh offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.25_0: One gives a gift to an ordinary person who has good ethical conduct.
ai-mn142:5.26_0: this is the thirteenth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.27_0: One gives a gift to an ordinary person who has bad ethical conduct.
ai-mn142:5.28_0: this is the thirteenth offering to an individual.
ai-mn142:5.29_0: One gives a gift to an animal.
ai-mn142:5.30_0: This is the fourteenth religious donation to an individual.

ai-mn142:7.1_0: But there are, Ānanda, seven religious donations bestowed on a Saṅgha.
ai-mn142:7.3_0: One gives a gift to the communities of both monks and nuns headed by the Buddha.
ai-mn142:7.4_0: this is the first offering to a Community.
ai-mn142:7.5_0: One gives a gift to the communities of both monks and nuns after the Buddha has finally become extinguished.
ai-mn142:7.6_0: this is the second offering to a Community.
ai-mn142:7.7_0: One gives a gift to the Saṅgha of monks.
ai-mn142:7.8_0: this is the third offering to a Community.
ai-mn142:7.9_0: One gives a gift to the Saṅgha of nuns.
ai-mn142:7.10_0: This is the fourth religious donation bestowed on a Saṅgha.
ai-mn142:7.11_0: One gives a gift, thinking: ‘Appoint this many monks for me from the Saṅgha.’
ai-mn142:7.12_0: this is the fifth offering to a Community.

ai-mn142:7.14_0: This is the sixth religious donation bestowed on a Saṅgha.
ai-mn142:7.15_0: One gives a gift, thinking: ‘Appoint this many nuns for me from the Saṅgha.’
ai-mn142:7.16_0: this is the seventh offering to a Community.
ai-mn142:8.1_0: In times to come there will be members of the spiritual family merely by virtue of wearing ocher cloth around their necks; but they are unethical and of bad character.
ai-mn142:8.2_0: But even a gift that is given to those unvirtuous ones because of the Community
ai-mn142:8.3_0: at that time, Ānanda, will be an immeasureable, unlimited offering to the Community, I say.
ai-mn142:8.4_0: But I say that there is no way a personal offering can be more fruitful than one bestowed on a Saṅgha.
ai-mn142:9.1_0: Ānanda, there are these four ways of purifying a religious donation.
ai-mn142:9.3_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by the giver, not the recipient.
ai-mn142:9.4_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by the recipient, not the giver.
ai-mn142:9.5_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by neither the giver nor the recipient.
ai-mn142:9.6_0: There’s a religious donation that’s purified by both the giver and the recipient.
ai-mn142:10.1_0: And how is a religious donation purified by the giver, not the recipient?
ai-mn142:10.2_0: It’s when the giver is ethical, of good character, but the recipient is unethical, of bad character.
ai-mn142:10.3_0: in this way, Ānanda, the offering is purified by the giver not by the receiver.
ai-mn142:11.1_0: And how is a religious donation purified by the recipient?
ai-mn142:11.2_0: It’s when the giver is unethical, of bad character, but the recipient is ethical, of good character.
ai-mn142:11.3_0: in this way, Ānanda, the offering is purified by the receiver not by the giver.
ai-mn142:12.1_0: And how is a religious donation purified by neither the giver nor the recipient?
ai-mn142:12.2_0: It’s when both the giver and the recipient are unethical, of bad character.
ai-mn142:12.3_0: in this way, Ānanda, the offering is purified neither by the giver nor by the receiver.
ai-mn142:13.1_0: And how is a religious donation purified by both the giver and the recipient?
ai-mn142:13.2_0: It’s when both the giver and the recipient are ethical, of good character.
ai-mn142:13.3_0: in this way, Ānanda, the offering is purified by the giver and by the receiver.
ai-mn142:13.4_0: These are the four ways of purifying a religious donation.”
ai-mn142:14.1_0: That is what the Buddha said.
ai-mn142:14.2_0: Then the Holy One, the Teacher, went on to say:
ai-mn142:14.3_0: “When an ethical person with trusting heart
ai-mn142:14.4_0: gives a proper gift to unethical persons,
ai-mn142:14.5_0: trusting in the ample fruit of deeds,
ai-mn142:14.6_0: that offering is purified by the giver.
ai-mn142:14.7_0: When an unethical and untrusting person,
ai-mn142:14.8_0: gives an improper gift to ethical persons,
ai-mn142:14.9_0: not trusting in the ample fruit of deeds,
ai-mn142:14.10_0: that offering is purified by the receivers.
ai-mn142:14.11_0: When an unethical and untrusting person,
ai-mn142:14.12_0: gives an improper gift to ethical persons,
ai-mn142:14.13_0: not trusting in the ample fruit of deeds,
ai-mn142:14.14_0: I declare that gift is not very fruitful.
ai-mn142:14.15_0: When an ethical person with trusting heart
ai-mn142:14.16_0: gives a proper gift to unethical persons,
ai-mn142:14.17_0: trusting in the ample fruit of deeds,
ai-mn142:14.18_0: I declare that gift is abundantly fruitful.
ai-mn142:14.19_0: But when a passionless one gives to the passionless
ai-mn142:14.20_0: gives a proper gift to unethical persons,
ai-mn142:14.21_0: trusting in the ample fruit of deeds,
ai-mn142:14.22_0: That gift is the highest of worldly gifts.”
